title: 'Should I divorce him or should I become his rival?': Wife writes funny fan-fiction story of her grown-up husband roleplaying as a cat online for 3 years, internet reacts hilariously and mistakes her silliness for seriousness
description: We're not going to lie to you, feline fam, we have often dreamed of mysteriously waking up one day in the body of a cat. Just leaving behind our jobs, our friends, even ice cream, all to be a lazy house cat purrfectly perturbed by our inept hoomans. However, that dream has stayed a dream because we know it's not physically pawssible (yet). However, there are others that take it one step further by pretending to be a cat…online. Now, we must be clear that this story is 100% fiction, but we're sure there are people who do this for real. The poster (wife) wrote an absolutely hissterical fan-fiction post about her husband pretending to be a cat online for three years. But, that's not even the best part. The commenters somehow seemed to miss the fact that it was not real, and their reactions are purrfectly serious. It's a giant trainwreck of a post, but it's one we can't look away from in all the funniest ways. Soak up all the silliness below!
author: Blake Seidel
excerpt: 'Should I divorce him or should I become his rival?': Wife writes funny fan-fiction story of her grown-up husband roleplaying as a cat online for 3 years, internet reacts hilariously and mistakes her silliness for seriousness - World's largest collection of cat memes and other animals
text: After writing for I Can Has Cheezburger for years, you start to become a bit desensitized to the internet. However, there are some posts and images that make us giggle as if we're seeing them for the first time. This is one of them. Even now, as we're writing this, we can't stop laughing. We get it. We get it more than we would like to admit. It might be fun to pretend to be a cat for a few hours every day. Cats are the best. They don't care about anyone except themselves and are hilarious. It might even be more fun than being ourselves.

After writing for I Can Has Cheezburger for years, you start to become a bit desensitized to the internet. However, there are some posts and images that make us giggle as if we're seeing them for the first time. This is one of them. Even now, as we're writing this, we can't stop laughing.

We get it. We get it more than we would like to admit. It might be fun to pretend to be a cat for a few hours every day. Cats are the best. They don't care about anyone except themselves and are hilarious. It might even be more fun than being ourselves.
